Author: Oszy#5734
Content: üéÜ  Web DEX üéÜ

Author: passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã#0622
Content: I was told web wallets are unsafe - so how is webdex different ?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
It is as safe or if not more than trading in a Centralised Exchange
it is certainly not recommended to hold huge amounts in a address generated by the web-dex
but accessibility wise, it is a huge improvement

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: web is only unsafe it it sends sensitive info like login seed over the internet, my guess it it can authenticate you locally without having to send your details to a server. after that everything is encrypted.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: there can be extensions installed that have permissions to read all data in all webpages, which can be security holes

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: there's always that

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
the webdex itself won't transfer any privkeys/seed phrases over the internet, but the browser environment that surrounds the webdex can be a concern for security
if you trust your browser to login to a bank account or a centralised exchange, then our web-dex dealing with trading amounts should be ok as well

Author: Acura#2748
Content: A user is asking:  What about the storage or transmission of IP address, browser, operating system, etc.? So such data which are transferred when calling a www-address? (Webdex)

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
```
IP address, browser, operating system, etc.
```
these are basic data that are necessary to communicate over the internet
if they will be logged or not is a different issue
I think they won't be logged
we won't know the situation till we have launched it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: logged to where? it will be running as a localhost app

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: the server that serves the atomicdex webapp will know the ipaddress of a person requesting it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the localhost "server"?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: like your node http://127.0.0.1:port

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that server?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
I mean something like
web.atomicdex.io
where it will be hosted

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i am not sure we are talking about the hosted version

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but yes, for a hosted version such info would be able to be logged

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: yes, the question was about webdex accessed though a browser

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: through the browser to localhost vs webdex.atomicdex.io are totally different things

Author: bogybogy#3962
Content:
Gents who can answer in a plain English for General people to understand-Block #597,273 was mined 119 minutes after its parent.

This happened only 10 times in Bitcoin's history, last time in May of 2014.

Assuming blocks come in 10 minutes in average, this interblock time has a 0.000679% chance of occurring.
